title: iOS developers can now publish unlisted apps, accessible with a private link
content:
When developers build apps, they don’t always have mass-distribution in mind. Some apps cater to select groups of users that the developer targets. Apple already allows devs to geo-restrict apps published on its store. This prevents users from other regions to download the app for various reasons — that differ from case to case. However,

The post iOS developers can now publish unlisted apps, accessible with a private link appeared first on xda-developers.
description: Apple now allows iOS developers to publish unlisted apps on the App Store. They are accessible to users through a private link.
